title: Add metrics yml files for usage data metrics definition
description:
Add `*_metrics.yml` file for usage data metrics definition, equivalent to Event dictionary we have now.

We have now 1210 metrics in [Event Dictionary](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VzE8R72Px_Y_LlE3Z05LxUlG_dumWe3vl-HeUo70TPw/edit#gid=618391485)

Consider how feature flags yml is working, could be similar 

### Proposal

* Use one file per metric.
* Store them under individual `lib/gitlab/usage_data/metrics/.._metrics.yml` with `ee/lib/ee/gitlab/usage_data/metrics/.._metrics.yml` for metric in ee
* Consider split per type in separate folders, `count_all`, `count_weekly`, `count_monthly`, `licence`, `settings` 

### Notes

* `full_path` should be unique, full_path is defining where the metric is placed in usage_data json payload
* define metrics name format, standardization [Naming and placing the metrics](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/product_analytics/usage_ping.html#1-naming-and-placing-the-metrics)
* start with metrics that are owned by ~"group::product analytics" 
* This metrics definition files can be also sent to version-app and we could use then for mapping

## Questions

* [ ] [Current event dictionary](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VzE8R72Px_Y_LlE3Z05LxUlG_dumWe3vl-HeUo70TPw/edit#gid=618391485) has 1210 lines.  Do we want to have 1210 metric yml definitions. What would this mean for the dictionary `dictionary.json` generated? 

## Next steps

* [x] Add basic support for usage data metrics definition https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/49126/
* [x] Add documentation   https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/50770
* [x] Add `ee` metrics definition https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/50990
* [x] Add rake task to generate metrics dictionary https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/294397

Metric definition schema https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/config/metrics/schema.json

### Example

```yml
# Metric files location -> lib/gitlab/usage_data/metrics/count_all/boards.yml

key_path: counts_monthy.deployments
description: Total deployments
value_type: number
product_category:
stage:
status: data_available
milestone:
milestone_removed:
introduced_by_url:
group: 'group::ops release'
time_frame: c28d
data_source: database
distribution: [ee, ce]
tier: ['free', 'starter', 'premium', 'ultimate', 'bronze', 'silver', 'gold']
```

@gitlab-org/growth/product_analytics/engineers here is a proposal for metrics definition, please feel free to add and update with your feedback, thank you!

title: [MR Analytics] Error message "hiding" below the fold
description:
### Problem to solve

On Merge Request Analytics, if there is an error loading the chart, a blue alert message is displayed.  However, it is displayed below the chart.  For many windows, that means it is displayed "below the fold" - only visible if the user scrolls down.  So in many cases it is not obvious that there has been an error.

### Proposal

On Merge Request Analytics, if there is an error loading the chart, the blue alert message should be displayed *above* the chart (not below).

### Screenshot

![Screen_Shot_2020-10-19_at_9.41.59_AM](/uploads/7a806f9cf75a77a3a61ca188099f7efd/Screen_Shot_2020-10-19_at_9.41.59_AM.png)

title: Group Code Coverage should use default instead of hardcoded branch name
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

<!-- Summarize the bug encountered concisely. -->

Users who have default branch names that aren't `master` do not get any data in the .csv download for [group code coverage](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/#repositories-analytics).

### Steps to reproduce

1. create a project with a default branch name that is anything bug `master`
2. merge to the branch with a code coverage job that calculates coverage
3. Navigate to the [Group Repository Analytics](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/repositories_analytics/index.html) and download the .csv file for all projects.

<!-- Describe how one can reproduce the issue - this is very important. Please use an ordered list. -->

### Example Project

N/A at this time

<!-- If possible, please create an example project here on GitLab.com that exhibits the problematic 
behavior, and link to it here in the bug report. If you are using an older version of GitLab, this 
will also determine whether the bug is fixed in a more recent version. -->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The project name with a default branch that is not `master` is not present in the report.

<!-- Describe what actually happens. -->

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

All projects should be present.

<!-- Describe what you should see instead. -->

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

<!-- Paste any relevant logs - please use code blocks (```) to format console output, logs, and code
 as it's tough to read otherwise. -->

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com

### Possible fixes

<!-- If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem. -->

The team discussed doing batch queries grouped by default branch names, something like this:

```
where(project_id: [1,2,3,4,5], ref_path: 'refs/heads/main')
where(project_id: [6,7], ref_path: 'refs/heads/deployment-or-whatever')
```

Now that https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/45702 has been implemented, we should have the [default branch name available](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/ci/daily_build_group_report_result.rb#L18) for our query and this fix should be possible.

```ruby
Ci::DailyBuildGroupReportResult.with_default_branch
```

#### Alternate Proposal

We could chain our new scope: with_default_branch (introduced in !45702) to our existing finder to filter coverage only for the default branch. We might need to tweak our finder to make it ref_path agnostic in order to return the right data. I see here an opportunity to extend our existing finder to make it more flexible.

What would be the impact on the data returned if we were to chain it to the existing finder? (i.e. what does it return right now and what would it return with this change?)

title: On boards, let any license hide backlog/closed list
description:
hide backlog/closed lists checkboxes are still available on EE version without a license, however when changed 
nothing happens.  

![list_bug](/uploads/5f52f0c3d332dbd5293f629e215528f3/list_bug.png)  

Based on discussion with UX and @gweaver we'vee decided that we'll support this in Core. We, therefore, need to persist the values on backend.

>>> 

First we need to decide if these options are supposed to be shown when `scoped_issue_boards` feature 
is not available(without a starter license). 

#### Possible fixes 

* If checkboxes are **NOT** supposed to be behind a license we need to fix ~backend to always persist those values  

* If checkboxes are supposed to be behind a license we need to fix ~frontend and ~backend to only show the checkboxes and do the filtering if `scoped_issue_boards` feature is available.  

For more context check https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/218031#note_431977225
>>>

title: Investigate deprecating global_id in favour of id in DastScannerProfile mutations
description:
The following discussion from !40225 should be addressed:

- [ ] @.luke started a [discussion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/40225#note_430588036):  (+4 comments)

    > @philipcunningham I wonder if this change was necessary? The `id` field was [already expressed as a Global ID](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/api_graphql_styleguide.html#exposing-global-ids). I think we can freely swap a `GraphQL::ID_TYPE` in a type with `::Types::GlobalIDType[::DastScannerProfile]` because the client receives both as a `String`, and in this case, both fields produce the same `String`. cc @alexkalderimis to fact-check me here :slight_smile:.

</hr>

> @philipcunningham I wonder if we could:
> 
> * Change the `id` field to be a `::Types::GlobalIDType[::DastScannerProfile]`
> * un-deprecate `id`
> * deprecate `global_id`
> 
> It may seem a bit odd to un-deprecate, but I think this should be fine. Deprecating `global_id` at least allows a non-breaking change going forward (rather than revert of this MR).
> 
> It'd be a shame for this type to not have an `id` field, when it could keep it.

title: DAST site validation - Populate validation section when editing a profile - Frontend
description:
This is ~frontend implementation issue for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/267100

## Why are we doing this work

Currently when editing an existing profile (with site validation enabled and in-progress validation) the validation section is hidden and a status-text is displayed instead.

This page should be in the same state as when the user left it: the validation section should be visible and the form should be populated with the user-entered values:

## Relevant links

| MVC (current) | Ideal |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![localhost_3000_root_security-reports-playground_-_security_configuration_dast_profiles_dast_site_profiles_42_edit__1_](/uploads/7a1b61dd8a61c83792ddbfa93094da22/localhost_3000_root_security-reports-playground_-_security_configuration_dast_profiles_dast_site_profiles_42_edit__1_.png) | ![localhost_3000_root_security-reports-playground_-_security_configuration_dast_profiles_dast_site_profiles_new](/uploads/bea83abdc5a42aec77b697d6e83a2c0e/localhost_3000_root_security-reports-playground_-_security_configuration_dast_profiles_dast_site_profiles_new.png)|

## Implementation plan

- [ ] Add `token`, `tokenId`, `strategy`, `validationPath` to
  - [ ] `dastSiteValidation` query
  - [ ] Pass it as a props to `ee/app/assets/javascripts/security_configuration/dast_site_profiles_form/components/dast_site_validation.vue` 
- [ ] Add logic to handle validation section visibility for following states
  - [ ] PENDING_VALIDATION
  - [ ] INPROGRESS_VALIDATION
  - [ ] PASSED_VALIDATION
  - [ ] FAILED_VALIDATION
- [ ] Add specs to verify validation section is visible when editing a profile

title: Group Migration - Include subgroups during group import
description:
Followup from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/44836#note_428835344 

When https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/44836/ is merged it's going to be possible to import top level groups using GraphQL. However, subgroups are not included in the import. 

We need to include subgroups when performing import of a group.

title: Remove duplicated display properties from HAML files (13.6)
description:
For example, `.d-none.d-sm-none` in a HAML is redundant, and we can use just `.d-none` there.

Also `.d-block.d-sm-block.d-md-block.d-lg-inline` can be converted into the equivalent classes `.d-block.d-lg-inline`.

### Refs.

- https://getbootstrap.com/docs/4.5/utilities/display/#hiding-elements

----

cf. #264790 in %13.5

title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `ci_pipeline_editor_page`
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## What

The `Pipeline Editor` is becoming the new home of the ~"group::pipeline authoring" team. It will house our text and visual pipeline editor, along with a preview of the pipelines they'll have as users update them.

Remove the `:ci_pipeline_editor_page` feature flag.

### Current Implementation State

You may view the current state of implementation at ~"workflow::staging":

https://staging.gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/ci/editor

This page may take a few iterations before becoming public, and we will want approval of our Product and ~UX team members.

## Owners

- Team: ~"group::pipeline authoring" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_pipeline-authoring`
- Best individual to reach out to: @mrincon 

## Expectations

A new pipeline editor is added with a simple UX as a first iteration.

### What are we expecting to happen?

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->

## Beta groups/projects

If applicable, any groups/projects that are happy to have this feature turned on early. Some organizations may wish to test big changes they are interested in with a small subset of users ahead of time for example.

- `gitlab-org/gitlab` project
- `gitlab-org`/`gitlab-com` groups
- ...

## Roll Out Steps

- [x] Enable on staging (`/chatops run feature set feature_name true --staging`)
  - [x] Enabled on globally on staging: https://staging.gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/ci/editor
- [x] Test on staging
- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated
  - [x] Issue: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/297367
- [x] Enable on GitLab.com for individual groups/projects listed above and verify behaviour  (`/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab feature_name true`)
  - [x] Enabled on `samdbeckham/test`: https://gitlab.com/samdbeckham/test/-/ci/editor
- [x] Coordinate a time to enable the flag with `#production` and `#g_delivery` on slack.
- [x] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com
- [x] Enable on GitLab.com by running chatops command in `#production` (`/chatops run feature set feature_name true`)
- [x] Cross post chatops Slack command to `#support_gitlab-com` ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#where-to-run-commands)) and in your team channel
- [x] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled
- [x] Remove feature flag and add changelog entry
- [x] After the flag removal is deployed, [clean up the feature flag](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up) by running chatops command in `#production` channel

```

---

Found this while checking how the worker is performing since it was implemented in 13.4 (https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/223156) and only performs on a job 14 days after an MR is closed/merged.

For some reason, there are some merge requests without a head ref. The line in the service code fails because it's expecting that an MR always has one.

title: POC create sitemap for gitlab-org group and subgroup including public projects
description:
The idea behind this issue is to analyze how useful a sitemap including all public projects in GitLab.com would be to increase the search crawling engines.

For this, we're going to start generating a sitemap for the gitlab-org group and subgroups including their public projects. This sitemap doesn't need an index because the number of links generated is below the high limit established for sitemaps (50.000 links).

Per each group we're going to render the following links:
- group overview
- epics (in case the group has them)
- issues
- merge requests
- packages and registries

Per each public project we're going to generate:
- project overview
- issues
- merge requests
- packages and registries
- snippets

For the purpose of this POC, before generating the sitemap, we need to retrieve first how many of the URLs generated are already indexed. Then, comparing the previous indexed files and the new ones we can measure how effective the sitemap could be for all public project and groups in .com.
